name: CellChorus
headline: The dynamic single-cell analysis company
description:
At CellChorus, we apply artificial intelligence to evaluate thousands of microscopy videos in parallel to evaluate how immune cells move, interact and perform over time. This allows our customers to discover, develop, manufacture and deliver cell therapies, antibodies, vaccines and other novel therapies faster, at lower expense, and with higher rates of success.

Our customers include top-25 biopharma companies and seed-stage biotechs that are developing cell therapies, antibody therapeutics and vaccines (including one of the few companies with an approved CAR T cell therapy).

Hear from the team at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IE9x_tm0XnI

founders.name: Dan Meyer, Founder
founders.description:
Daniel Meyer is the CEO of CellChorus, the leader in providing dynamic single-cell functional analysis to the life sciences industry. 

Dan was the Chief Operating Officer and a board member of Genospace until its acquisition by HCA Healthcare (NYSE:HCA). He was a member of the venture capital investment teams at Arboretum Ventures and PJC.vc.

Dan holds a B.A. in mathematics and economics from Middlebury College and an M.B.A. from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth.

# Understand which cells perform best, and why
[ Technology ](https://cellchorus.com/</technology/workflows>)
### The only single-cell technology that simultaneously evaluates how individual cells move, activate, interact, kill and survive
Scientists rely on the TIMING™ platform to quantify the spatiotemporal performance of thousands of immune cells to understand which candidates to move into clinical trials, to understand clinical response, and to maintain consistent manufacturing
![A single well with one effector cell and multiple target cells. The target cells fluoresce red until the undergo apoptosis and turn purple](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f467c6b965b0814b9e0ee96/1600967020125-EMB3VCVHQK1FWPY18VZH/A+single+well+with+one+effector+cell+and+multiple+target+cells.+The+target+cells+fluoresce+red+until+the+undergo+apoptosis+and+turn+purple)
### Visually evaluate how your cells perform and interact over time
Time-lapse Imaging Microscopy in Nanowell Grids (TIMING) applies neural network based detection to evaluate thousands of individual cell-cell interactions
[Example Videos](https://cellchorus.com/</videos>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f467c6b965b0814b9e0ee96/a6ddbccc-9c27-4ebe-8316-548b69de7630/Characterize.jpg)
### Characterize migration, contact dynamics, and cell death for thousands of cells 
CellChorus applies artificial intelligence to conduct thousands of microscopy experiments in parallel to characterize migration, cell-cell interactions, cytotoxicity, survival, and biomolecule secretion at high-throughput and at single-cell resolution 
[Applications](https://cellchorus.com/</technology/platform>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f467c6b965b0814b9e0ee96/e37afa1a-d8b1-478f-98f4-6a552d5954b4/integratedProfiling2.jpg)
### Integrate motion and performance with multi‑omic profiling
CellChorus can identify and retrieve cells of interest to link functional profiling with information from analysis modalities such as single-cell RNA sequencing and flow cytometry to provide a comprehensive understanding of cellular function, state and phenotype.
[Technology](https://cellchorus.com/</technology/workflows>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f467c6b965b0814b9e0ee96/1598470896088-CLNFDOIBOBARM2WZNH7F/BG3dark.jpg)
### “Everybody is used to running assays, but with TIMING we can see new biology that we didn’t even think about—new hypotheses, new insights, and new ways of thinking about the cell.”
— Navin Varadarajan, PhD, Founder of CellChorus
### Broad Application
The CellChorus platform is adaptable to your biology, cell types and applications.
Publications-home

generated_description:
**CellChorus: Dynamic Single-Cell Analysis**

Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S21, CellChorus is bringing a fresh and fierce approach to single-cell analysis based in Houston, Texas. With a compact team of four, they leverage artificial intelligence to transform how scientists visualize and analyze immune cell interactions through their unique TIMING™ platform—Time-lapse Imaging Microscopy in Nanowell Grids.

**What They Do:** 
CellChorus utilizes cutting-edge technology to evaluate thousands of microscopy videos simultaneously. This innovative approach allows them to accurately monitor how immune cells move, interact, and perform over time. The result? Quicker, cheaper, and more successful development of cell therapies, antibodies, and vaccines. They cater to a range of clients, from top-25 biopharma companies to budding biotech startups, including firms with approved CAR T-cell therapies.

**Key Technologies:**
- **Artificial Intelligence:** They apply machine learning to optimize the analysis of cell behavior.
- **TIMING™ Platform:** Offers spatiotemporal performance evaluation, enabling researchers to understand which immune cell candidates are worthy of clinical trials.

**Broad Applications:** 
From characterizing migration dynamics and cell death to integrating data from various analysis methods (like RNA sequencing and flow cytometry), their technology is versatile and applicable across a spectrum of biological queries.

**Why It Matters:** 
The implications are significant. With their platform, scientists can spot new biological insights, driving forward hypotheses that may have otherwise remained unexplored. As Navin Varadarajan, PhD and founder, notes, “Everybody is used to running assays, but with TIMING we can see new biology that we didn’t even think about."

For those interested in deeper engagement, you can view more about CellChorus and its innovative advancements [here](https://cellchorus.com), or hear from the team directly through their [YouTube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IE9x_tm0XnI).

In a nutshell, CellChorus is redefining the landscape of drug discovery, making strides toward more efficient therapeutic development with a powerful blend of AI and cellular insights.
